A Minimal Book Example Chapter 1 Prerequisites

A Minimal Book Example Yihui Xie 2020-09-14 Chapter 1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.name/tinytex/.

Chapter 2 Broken footnote citations Citations in footnotes do not appear at the end of chapter references. This is a citation (John Doe 2020).1 Citations in footnotes in line doesn’t work either.2 The citations in the footnotes do not show up in the end of chapter references section (right below this line), but does show up in the end of book references. References

Chapter 3 Workaround Footnote Citations The workaround is to include an invisible text chunk. This is a citation (John Doe 2020).3 This sentence has another footnote citation.4 Bob Johnson (2018) Jane Smith (2019) References
